intro: Trigonopyren albicostatus, commonly known as the white-bordered trigonopyren, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Apiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, triangular-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, white pubescence. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow in color. It is native to certain regions of Asia and thrives in moist, temperate environments. Due to its unique morphology and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists alike.
